The more important question is what will happen when they are forced to give back all the tokens?

Who then will stop the price from pumping?

$WLD 🧠 https://t.co/Kwhp9INGiT

Market makers own over 70% of the tokens in current circulation.

They borrowed them from the foundation for a price of approx $2.2 - 2.5$. 

This means that in a sense it is profitable for them to sell above the "borrow price" and buy it back at a lower price. Easy profit. https://t.co/8aVrmh4G2K https://t.co/MPDFMFCTXA

Every time $WLD pumps above $2,5 a magical force appears and pushing the price down. 

You may ask why this is happening?

I think tokenomics and deal with market makers is the answer 👇 https://t.co/mLk6sQRi26

If I were the one in charge of the protocol and its airdrop strategy, I'd say that now is the perfect time to make the announcement.
